Events that occurred on 26 October.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1916 - While in reserve, J.R.R. Tolkien's battalion is inspected by Sir Douglas Haig, the British commander, at the Battle of the Somme.
1945 - Jane Chance is born.
1958 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to L.M. Cutts.
1966 - Finding himself short of a speech subject, J.R.R. Tolkien reads Smith of Wootton Major to a room of about 800 people.
1994 - Tyalië Tyelelliéva issue 2 is published.
2003 - RingCon III in Tacoma, Washington.
2005 - Scholar Angus McIntosh, pupil and friend of J.R.R. Tolkien, dies.
2017 - Roger Garland dies.

content.title: In Arda
content.content:
F.A. 495:
Tuor, guided by Voronwë, travels to Gondolin in order to deliver Ulmo's message to Turgon.
T.A. 3018:
Frodo and Samwise rest in Rivendell and prepare for their quest to destroy the One Ring.
New moon[1]
